meanings.definition: Torqueses (noun): plural form of torque, a twisting force
meanings.sent1: The torqueses applied to the screwdriver helped tighten the screw.
meanings.sent2: He used a wrench to increase the torqueses on the bolt.
meanings.sent3: The torqueses in the machine seemed to have a mind of their own, twisting and turning unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted like torqueses, slowly but surely moving her towards her goal.
meanings.sent5: The torqueses of the tornado uprooted trees and scattered debris everywhere.

meanings.definition: Torqueses (verb): third person singular present of torque, to twist or turn forcefully
meanings.sent1: She torqueses the lid of the jar until it finally opens.
meanings.sent2: The athlete torqueses his body to throw the javelin with great force.
meanings.sent3: The dancer torqueses gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience with her movements.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds torqueses the branches of the trees, causing them to sway violently.
meanings.sent5: He torqueses the key in the lock, hoping it will finally turn and open the door.
